subject: Critical Thinking
title: How to Actually Change Someone's Mind
description: A quick win: understand How to Actually Change Someone's Mind.

hook.text: Facts alone rarely change minds. If they did, climate change & vaccine debates would be over.

buildup.text: Effective persuasion follows a pattern: build rapport, understand their reasoning, find common ground, then introduce.

discovery.text: The 'deep canvassing' technique â€“ asking people to share personal experiences related to the'ssue â€“ changes minds 10x.

twist.text: The key: don't attack their belief. Ask questions that lead them to discover contradictions themselves.

climax.text: People change their minds all the time â€“ just not in arguments. They change privately, gradually, & when they feel safe.

punchline.text: You can't force someone to change their mind. You can make it safe for them to.

quiz.question: What is the most effective technique for changing deeply held beliefs?
options: Asking people to share personal experiences and discover contradictions themselves
